text: HackerRank | Prepare Certify Compete Apply Search   1  All Contests SRBD Code Contest - 2024 (Round 2) Weird Subarray  Weird Subarray locked Problem Submissions Discussions Time Limit: ++ Memory Limit: You're given an array of length . We deﬁne the compositeness of an index as the length of the largest subarray such that the below conditions meet: 1. . In other words, the subarray contains the th index. 2. The greatest common divisor of the elements of the subarray is greater than . That is, If no such subarray exists for index , the compositeness of is considered to be . For each index of the given array, ﬁnd its compositeness. Note: A subarray is a contiguous part of an array. For example, , and are subarrays of the array but is not. Input Format The ﬁrst line contains one integer — the length of the array. Next line contains integers — the elements of the array Constraints Output Format Print integers — the of which denotes the compositeness of index . Sample Input 0 7 2 4 6 24 15 3 3 Sample Output 0 4 4 5 5 5 5 5 Explanation 0 For index and , we can choose the subarray .
